stlcsb 0.1.0.9000

CSB intersections

csb_intersection.Rd

csb_intersectionreturns a logical vector indicating `TRUE` for addresses that are intersections. This function is also able to isolate or remove these data.

csb_intersection(.data, var, newVar, filter = FALSE, remove = FALSE)

Arguments

.data

A tibble with raw CSB data
var

name of column containing address
newVar

Name of output variable to be created with logical
filter

If true, returns a filtered version of the input with only observations occurring at intersections
remove

If true, returns a version of the input without observations occuring at intersections

Value

csb_intersectionreturns a logical vector for addresses that are intersections, or it filters intersections

Examples

# NOT RUN {
csb_intersection(january_2018, PROBADDRESS, newVar = Intersection)
# }
csb_intersection(january_2018, PROBADDRESS, filter = TRUE)
#> No argument specified for newVar, no logical will be appended
#> 1454 observations were filtered out
#> # A tibble: 234 x 19
#>    CALLERTYPE DATECANCELLED       DATEINVTDONE        DATETIMECLOSED

csb_intersection(january_2018, PROBADDRESS, remove = TRUE)
